title: Boy pronounced dead in Hummelstown home after suffering gunshot wound, police say
content:
HUMMELSTOWN -- A boy suffered a fatal gunshot wound in a Hummelstown home Thursday evening, according to borough police.
Borough police Cpl. Justin Hess said police were withholding the identity and age of the minor pending the notification of the victim's family, but "all persons involved in this incident are accounted for and there is no threat to the public."
Hess declined to comment on whether other people were in the home at the time of the shooting, as well as the circumstances surrounding incident.
Law enforcement and the Dauphin County Forensic Team were called to a home at about 5:30 p.m. in the 200 block of West Main Street Thursday after receiving a report of a male with a gunshot wound. Officers gave emergency medical care until EMS arrived to the scene, but the Dauphin County coroner's office ultimately pronounced the minor dead at the scene.
Hummelstown police are investigating the incident, and an autopsy will be scheduled for next week, Hess said.
Police are expected to release additional information as it is available.
A fund established in memory of Ciara Meyer, the 12-year-old girl who was shot and killed during an eviction in Perry County Jan. 11, is nearing $9,000.
